subject: Programming
title: Sunk Cost Fallacy in Projects
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sunk Cost Fallacy in Projects usable.

hook.text: We've spent six months on this approach. We can't throw it away now. But sometimes you should.

buildup.text: The sunk cost fallacy keeps teams investing in failing strategies because of past effort.

discovery.text: Past investment is irrelevant to the decision. Only future costs and benefits matter.

twist.text: Killing a project feels like admitting failure. In reality, it's admitting reality and saving resources.

climax.text: The courage to pivot or abandon bad code early saves more than stubbornly finishing the wrong thing.

punchline.text: Don't finish bad code just because you started it.

quiz.question: What is the sunk cost fallacy?
options: Continuing because of past investment, not future value
